medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 6 days prior to admission with vague abdominal pain that progressed over 24 hours, peaking in severe intensity at night. Following this peak, the patient began to feel better but did not continue to improve over the past days, experiencing persistent, dull, lower abdominal discomfort. The patient has been tolerating oral intake albeit with a decreased appetite and has been constipated, taking MiraLax with good effect. Additionally, there have been subjective fevers and chills.
